programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell finds what could be a valuable antique gun - or possibly a worthless fake. Jarrod and Brandi get their hands on a collection of Depression-era art.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a warm-up jersey signed by Kobe Bryant. Then, he has an axe to grind over a seller's asking price for an antique weapon.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team examines a 1973 Marshall Amp, and a hover-board from the movie Back to the Future Part II, signed by the cast.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth swaps the workstations for two members of his team. However, Les becomes angered at the situation, feeling that the arrangement was good enough in the first place.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Jeff calls in sick, leading to Seth to order everyone to stay away from his desk in any circumstances. He then finds Bobby J in the banned area, polishing a ring for a customer.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is asked to make a barber's chair look like a sports car, while Tyler and Ron deal with a disagreement by playing pranks on each other.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Pawn Stars' Chumlee gives the team an unusual challenge involving a pedal car. The crew also works on a 1960s motorcycle.

programme.title: Nightmare in Suburbia
programme.sub-title: The Babysitter and the Cyber Killer
programme.desc: The story of 19-year-old Katy Briscoe, who was stabbed to death after her killer set up fake Facebook identities to gain her trust.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: A case in which a popular young woman was murdered in Lancaster County. Pennsylvania investigators had to piece together the last few moments of her life to determine who killed her.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Auctions in Garland bring a day of dashed hopes and sweet profits. Plus, a new buyer begins to throw some of the bidders off their game.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers head to Fort Worth, where a local auctioneer stirs up trouble when he joins as bidder.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les sells a valuable Breitling watch for $42,000 to a trusted watch collector that he dealt with many times before. His customer does not have the funds, so Les gives him the merchandise in exchange for an IOU. Seth has grave misgivings about the deal, but Les still has trust in the customer.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a deal to get the others off his back, but when some interesting animals come through the door, it might be too much for him to resist.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed first edition of The Wonderful Wizard of Oz is brought into the shop and Corey races to check out a one-of-a-kind Turbo Drive II arcade game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick takes a look at some original blueprints to the Hoover Dam, and Chumlee has a potentially costly accident.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the complex relationship between presidents and aliens, contemplating how much such powerful men know about extra-terrestrials.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate mysterious beings with big heads and eyes, whose images were found carved into rocks. Known as the 'greys', they are rumoured to be alien life forms.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team restore a 1940s carnival game and a 19th-century nail gun.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick's plan to restore a 1950s motorcycle is hampered by missing parts. The team repairs an antique pencil dispenser.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Potential money-spinners include gold and silver coins, tax stamps, an album signed by Bob Marley, and a vintage Win-a-Card game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The experts assess an ancient coin, and an autographed movie poster for the movie Reservoir Dogs.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave wins a furniture unit, Darrell gets hold of some 1970s sound equipment, and Barry lays his hands on something truly vintage.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The guys bid for crates at a vault sale and Darrell prepares for a showdown with Dave.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba's nemesis Kenny Stowe shows up at tense auctions in Mesquite, where struggling Victor proves he is desperate for bargains.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Lesa Lewis and Jerry Simpson compete against Jenny Grumbles and Mary Padian at an auction on their own turf in Longview.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths are pushed to their limits when they must forge a signature blade from springs of steel, before recreating the mighty Horseman's Axe.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is on a roll when the world's rarest Hot Wheel car comes into the shop. Meanwhile, Chum puts pen to paper and writes his memoirs.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Beatlemania hits the shop when a signed 1963 guitar from the Fab Four is brought in. Meanwhile, Rick gives everyone a lesson in office etiquette.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts scrutinise the engineering behind the Egyptians' Sphinx and pyramids, questioning whether extra-terrestrial help was utilised to complete the structures.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts analyse whether natural causes were responsible for the volcanoes, earthquakes and floods of ancient times - and the possibility that it was down to aliens.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: With over 40,000 wristbands to sell, stored in 126 boxes, Les decides to sell them one by one, starting at $2 apiece. Seth and Ashley remain sceptical of the idea.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley make a series of bets to see if they or Les can purchase any item that comes into the store that they would otherwise dismiss as 'junk'.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod comes under pressure as his shop runs empty, while Barry tries to bring his losing streak to an end.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry Weiss's judgement is called into question and Darrell lays his hands on a timeless unit in Azusa. Jarrod insists it is quality that matters, not quantity.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey must decide if an original Casablanca movie poster is worth the six figures it will take to secure a deal. The work of Las Vegas pawnbrokers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The greatest treasures and biggest disappointments in Pawn Star history, including a violin with million-dollar potential and a document signed by John Hancock.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Morgan's first flight to the homestead hits a wall of bad weather. Tom runs a gauntlet of timber in search of some late-season fur.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: A truck transporting a vital cargo of pharmaceuticals plunges down a bank, a trailer splits open just before the morning rush, and Colin struggles to cope running the shop alone.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave wins a furniture unit, Darrell gets hold of some 1970s sound equipment, and Barry lays his hands on something truly vintage.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The guys bid for crates at a vault sale and Darrell prepares for a showdown with Dave.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents, as regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by one-time Bake Off champion Nadiya Hussain, comic and actor Michael Smiley, and comedians Bob Mortimer and Diane Morgan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed the liar of the week.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Comedy quiz show from 2014. Host Dara O Briain asks panellists to take an irreverent look at world events, with the Fifa World Cup in Brazil, the Commonwealth Games in Glasgow and that year's referendum on Scottish independence all possible targets for satirical comment. Regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by comedians Ed Byrne, Milton Jones, Romesh Ranganathan and Katherine Ryan for a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Regular panellist Alan Davies joined by comedy actor Chris Addison, broadcaster Sara Cox and Bake Off co-presenter Sue Perkins. In his last regular edition as host, Stephen Fry awards points for the answers he considers most interesting regardless of whether or not they are correct. Sandi Toksvig picks up Fry's baton from the 'n' series, but before then Fry will host two shows featuring his favourite moments.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by radio presenter Sara Cox, comedian Jason Manford, journalist Nick Robinson and actor Harry Shearer, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: Following an unsuccessful gig, Josh is surprised to be asked out by a very beautiful audience member, and together with Kate and Owen sets out to determine whether there is a catch. Meanwhile, landlord Geoff faces money problems and introduces Kate to the dizzying world of building management politics. Comedy, starring Josh Widdicombe, Elis James and Jack Dee.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Fantasy comedy starring James Buckley. A bored office worker is transported to a parallel world of wizards and warriors by a magic amulet.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Nottinghamshire Police force through officers' body-worn cameras.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The lives of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', who travel around the country trawling junk yards, garages, attics and barns for precious objects. The guys unearth ultra-rare skis for a Model T Ford as they pick one of the biggest barns they've ever seen.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: In Oxford, John goes against his wife's advice and ends up in a conflict with Dan, while Linda thinks she has spotted something the other bidders are yet to see, and George and Rupert take a risk on mysterious items hidden under dust sheets. Presented by Sean Kelly.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Nat and John's day in Glasgow gets off to a flying start, but Dan's dirty tactics lead to mayhem within the team. Meanwhile, George finds himself with a new pet.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank is tempted to go for broke when he spots the perfect oil can, and the spending spree continues at a mansion.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank get off the road for a behind-the-scenes look back at their most memorable moments together, featuring their dustiest adventures and most amazing discoveries.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John, Dave and Ros get an excuse to show off their knowledge of the second-hand police car market when end of service service vehicles are put up for auction.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Matt LeBlanc test drives the new Aston Martin V8 Vantage, while Rory Reid puts the Rolls-Royce Phantom through its paces to see if it lives up to its reputation as the best car in the world, and Chris Harris makes the case that a Ford Fiesta is better than a Lamborghini. With guest Stephen Mangan.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Keith engages in a high-speed pursuit after spotting a car being driven with a flat tyre. Even after the tyre disintegrates at 90mph, the driver still refuses to stop.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell, who invites cameras into his workshop as he builds customised cars from junk.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the comedy panel quiz, with questions relating to animals that start with the letter P. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by comedian Phill Jupitus, broadcaster Danny Baker and actress Teri Hatcher, who all try to come up with interesting answers.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedian Shappi Khorsandi, journalist and newsreader Michael Buerk, actress Amanda Abbington and comedian Elis James take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by comedy actors Warwick Davis and Hugh Dennis, comedian Katherine Ryan and journalist John Simpson, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by actors Kevin Bishop and Brian Blessed, comedian Josh Widdicombe and historian Kate Williams, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sean Lock, Romesh Ranganathan, Marcus Brigstocke
programme.desc: Eight Out of 10 Cats star Sean Lock hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before introducing routines by grumpy stand-up Romesh Ranganathan and actor and funnyman Marcus Brigstocke.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: In the semi-final, Nish Kumar is presented with a coconut harness, while a blindfolded Sally Phillips handles a slice of bread.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the comedy panel quiz, with questions relating to animals that start with the letter P. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by comedian Phill Jupitus, broadcaster Danny Baker and actress Teri Hatcher, who all try to come up with interesting answers.

programme.title: Monster Ships
programme.desc: The work carried out by ONE Columba, which is capable of carrying 14,000 shipping containers, but has the dangerous challenge of navigating twisting rivers and ancient ports.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How a team of intrepid engineers keep the London Array, one of the largest offshore wind farms on the planet, maintained and producing electricity whatever the weather.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Hitler's Miracle Weapons
programme.desc: Unusual weapons created by German scientists during the Second World War, including giant cannons, V2 rockets and a 200-ton tank, and how they influenced future arms developments.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of Hudson Yards on Manhattan Island, New York, a construction project built over the tracks and railway sidings of Penn Station - literally in thin air.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to France to explore the possibility that Jesus married Mary Magdalene, and they had children. He meets respected scholars, authors and historians to consider the theory the son of God's bloodline lives on today.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: How the SAS War Crimes Investigation Team tried to pinpoint the location of Gestapo officers who were wanted for a host of atrocities.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at some of Switzerland's 300,000 subterranean bunkers, built across history. Plus, the extraordinary creation of a Liverpool entrepreneur that's shrouded in mystery, and a network of man-made tunnels used by adventurous subterranean thrill-seekers deep beneath Slovenia's landscape.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: Staff cope with the pressure of rush hour during the summer, with Lorel Kinghorn trying to get a group of rowdy schoolchildren safely on board a train without causing major delays on the line. There is a chance to find out what happens during the routine weekly maintenance, and Network Rail's Steve Hawkins and Emma Taylor take to the air as part of their commitment to preserve some of the most historic parts of the railway.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A 1970s Bond Bug three-wheeler divides opinion among Mathewsons customers, while a retired engineer reluctantly auctions off his late father's treasured 60s Jaguar Mark 2.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: The Wieliczka Salt mine in southern Poland, some 327 metres deep, where the voids left behind from excavating salt have been transformed into extraordinary spaces, carved by hand.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of the Allied forces hunt for Joachim Peiper, the man responsible for the massacre of American PoWs in Malmedy, Belgium.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team struggles to explain how a DAF 33 gearbox works, and office manager Sarah attempts to bring order to the auto memorabilia sale.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: The crew visits Germany to collect a multi-million-pound maintenance machine so large it will need to be loaded onto two trucks. Eric and Chris oversee a diesel-engine exchange.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: Documentary explaining how a squadron of low-flying bombers freed resistance fighters from Amiens Jail during the Second World War.

programme.title: Monster Ships
programme.desc: Battling harsh conditions, we follow Algoma Sault on a 2000km odyssey across the Great Lakes.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The murder of two Glasgow women prompts the detectives to investigate an apparently respectable escort agency. Meanwhile, a man from the Highlands reports his wife missing. James Macpherson stars.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Robert serves on the Re-Vaccination Committee. When Emmaline comes to the Bramwells' house for help, they suspect she may suffer a reaction to Finn's vaccination experiments.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Hugh Wallis turns the tables on Sam Nixon by dropping in at Sun Hill and accusing her of abducting her own daughter. As the tug of love moves toward a dramatic conclusion, Sam desperately tries to make Abi realise she has been brainwashed - and Jack Meadows isn't as supportive as he might be. Elsewhere, Scott Burnett's wife is found murdered and Honey Harmon oversteps the bounds of duty when she attempts to comfort the grieving widower. Drama, starring Lisa Maxwell and Georgia Moffett.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: There is joy in the air as Robert Bramwell and Alice prepare to wed. Unfortunately for Eleanor, his impending move to Alice's sumptuous Kew residence also threatens her livelihood.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jessica Bailey finds it a struggle to fit in amongst the regiment, and an officer makes Chris McLeod jealous after he returns from leave.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Hugh Wallis turns the tables on Sam Nixon by dropping in at Sun Hill and accusing her of abducting her own daughter. As the tug of love moves toward a dramatic conclusion, Sam desperately tries to make Abi realise she has been brainwashed - and Jack Meadows isn't as supportive as he might be. Elsewhere, Scott Burnett's wife is found murdered and Honey Harmon oversteps the bounds of duty when she attempts to comfort the grieving widower. Drama, starring Lisa Maxwell and Georgia Moffett.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Connie investigates Dominic's death, and becomes very suspicious of Diane's behaviour - especially when she learns of their past relationship and the medical cause of the fatal accident. Mark tries to make peace with Chrissie, but to no avail, and two student doctors have a disastrous first day on the job, both managing to get on the wrong side of Owen.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Mark has reservations about locum doctor Archie's competence, a groom-to-be panics when being prepared for his injections prior to his foreign honeymoon, and a boy is injured during a confrontation between his father and teacher.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sam struggles to prove that Hugh Wallis abducted, brainwashed and raped her daughter, but the suspect arrogantly sticks to his story that Abi instigated the sexual relationship that has left her pregnant and emotionally wrecked. DCs Jo Masters and Suzie Sim investigate a case involving rent boys and pornography which implicates DI Neil Manson's father-in-law, a Deputy Assistant Commissioner at Scotland Yard and, undaunted by the risk of making enemies in high places, Jack Meadows organises a raid on the officer's home. Honey Harman confesses her unprofessional behaviour to Steve Hunter, but her next anguished encounter with Scott Burnett leads to another tender embrace. Drama, starring Lisa Maxwell and Robert Gwilym.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark finds himself unable to deal with Gill's death, and Mandy finds something out about Gill.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dot and Ethel have an afternoon out to mark Ethel's wedding anniversary and to meet Maj Grace. Mark tries to cope with his grief, and Kathy learns not to rely on Nigel.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: An explosion in a sewer prompts the team to rescue the workers who have been trapped in the rubble, while the arrival of a new station officer at Blackwall causes a stir.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The Greek Orthodox Church challenges the ownership of Lord Dunwich's valuable 17th-century communion vessel, and the dodgy dealer is called in to investigate. Comedy drama, directed by and starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim faces a moral dilemma after Charlie organises the first Jersey International Music Festival. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Questions trouble the Boswell household - will Ma be reunited with Freddie, and what really happened to Uncle Charlie's money?.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Peggy the chalet maid tells Jeffrey she has a burning ambition to become a Yellowcoat, so he arranges an interview for her. Comedy, starring Su Pollard, Simon Cadell, Ruth Madoc, Paul Shane and Jeffrey Holland.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean becomes concerned that Lionel's new passion for model boat-building is not active enough, and decides to rouse him from his lethargy by inspiring him to write another book. Comedy, starring Judi Dench, Geoffrey Palmer and Moira Brooker.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Howard Gets Double Booked
programme.desc: Howard discovers he has mistakenly agreed to take Pearl and Marina out to dinner at the same time. Long-running comedy from the pen of Roy Clarke, starring Robert Fyfe, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The discovery of an Asian man's body sparks another case for Lynley and Havers, plunging them into a murky world of illicit sexuality, racial tension and family loyalties. As the investigation becomes increasingly tangled and complex, Havers takes drastic action to save a child's life - which leaves her career in jeopardy. Detective drama, starring Nathaniel Parker and Sharon Small, with Saeed Jaffrey.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the kidnapping of two boys in 1979, which they believe could be linked to a recent spate of disappearances. The youngsters involved in the earlier case escaped - though their abductor was never found. Fearing they may be on the trail of a serial killer, the detectives also uncover a link with another unsolved case - the assault on a champion fisherman.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Jardine and Reid search for a link in a murder case, while Ross and Fraser realise a racing fraud may have wider implications than they first thought. Feature-length episode of the detective drama, starring James Macpherson and Blythe Duff.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's leading stories with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Inside the Crown: Secrets of the Royals
programme.desc: The documentary explores how the Queen has responded in times of sadness and grief, as she faced personal tragedies and national disasters including the Aberfan disaster, the Grenfell fire, and the IRA's murder of Lord Mountbatten. The Queen also faced her so-called 'Annus Horribilis' in 1992, when family scandal, press ridicule and the catastrophic Windsor Castle fire tested her skills as monarch and mother to the limit, and, of course the death of Diana, Princess of Wales, when her slow response to the nation's grief threatened to destabilise the monarchy.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news and lifestyle features. Bill Nighy talks about starring as Mr Woodhouse in the new film adaptation of Emma.

credits.actor: as Mr Woodhouse in the new film adaptation of Emma

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family of five from Essex calling themselves Showaddiwaddilove answer questions about top 10 lists, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Kerry, Amy, Paul and Rory pit their wits against quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but if anyone is caught they're out for good, leaving fewer players for the final chase.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Scottish National Party.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Vanessa argues with Charity over the secret, Dawn encourages Will to think outside the box, and Liam and Leyla find themselves in an awkward moment.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Vanessa is worried, Ryan is forced to get Dawn to keep his secret, and she makes a discovery.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: In 10 years Airbnb has grown into a multimillion-dollar global entity - and revolutionised the way people travel. But there are claims that short-term lets not only threaten the future of traditional hotels, but could be contributing to housing shortages - as well as driving up the cost of properties. Jonathan Maitland investigates.

programme.title: Tyson Fury: The Gypsy King
programme.desc: The opening instalment in a three-part documentary following the boxer as he prepares for his rematch with Deontay Wilder for the WBC World Heavyweight title, after the first contest in December 2018 ended in a much-disputed draw. Filmed over several months, the programme provides an insight into the life of one of British sport's most flamboyant and controversial characters and those who are closest to him.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: The British love chocolate, so Sian Williams investigates what makes it so irresistible and gets the public tucking into theCadbury's chocolate bar with 30 per cent less sugar to see if it as tasty as it is healthy. Two more diets are also put to the test - the Meal Prepping for Weight-loss Diet, in which calorie-counted meals are all prepared in advance, and the Diabetes Weight-loss cookbook, road-tested by a woman who is borderline type 2 diabetic.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Keen to unwind, Geordie and Will head to a charity boxing match at Vic's gym. However, as Matthew and Luke face off in the ring the bout takes an unexpected twist. Will wonders if he's misjudged Matthew all along and when two boys are later found near death, Will must face up to his own part in the tragedy to help uncover the truth. Meanwhile, Leonard tries to reunite the warring Chapmans, who seem determined never to see eye-to-eye again. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Brentford v Leeds United and Swansea City v Queens Park Rangers.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is on the lookout for a two-seat roadster with attitude in the form of an original BMW Z1, which could make a tidy profit after Edd China works his magic.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini gets a lead on a collection of his newest obsession, brass cars, with a 1913 Hudson, a 1910 Stoddard-Dayton, a 1906 Oldsmobile and a Redding motorcycle on offer. Wayne wants to buy just the Hudson, but it turns out it's a package deal.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini helps Olympic gold medalist Jonny Mosely and the Squaw Valley ski resort find a vehicle that could have been at the 1960 Winter Olympics.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part two of two. Paul Teutul Sr's vintage bike is unveiled to the public at a magazine photoshoot, and Chris Matthews completes his restoration of a classic machine.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: When a 1941 Buick Coupe rolls into FantomWorks, it is the worst possible combination for Dan and the team - a very difficult car and a very demanding owner.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe heads to South Carolina, where he tries brick-making, and a cranberry bog in Oregon.

programme.title: Snooker: Welsh Open
programme.desc: Action from the third day at the Motorpoint Arena in Cardiff.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz unleash a sleek '67 Jaguar in a New Jersey garage and later pick a general store with a Presidential past.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Brentford v Leeds United and Swansea City v Queens Park Rangers.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove visit two amazing sets of sheds in Hampshire, where they find plenty of Japanese bikes - but they come away with a real surprise. Selling their projects on, however, proves to be a challenge.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove are in the heart of Oxfordshire where they find rare Minis, 1970s Rollers and a pristine rally car - but can they get her running and profitable?.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Trading Up
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to trade a little 'kei car' in Japan, but worries cultural differences might stop him from making a profit.

programme.title: Extreme Car Hoarders
programme.sub-title: A Hoarder, a Van and a Plan
programme.desc: Chuck Palumbo and Rick Dore attempt to convince Kregg to part with his huge hoard of Corvairs for which they will transform his beat-up van.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini visits a local farm to examine a Studebaker, and later discovers a 922 Martin motorbike and sidecar.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Chopped
programme.desc: Car dealer Mike Brewer buys a classic Panda Fiat 4x4 and persuades Edd China to transform it into an impressive off-road drive. But, it needs a lot of work..

programme.title: Live Snooker: Welsh Open
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day four at the Motorpoint Arena in Cardiff, featuring third-round matches.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Panicked Paraglider, Shocking Safari, Runaway Rocket
programme.desc: Hair-raising home-video footage demonstrates what can happen if a paraglider fails to maintain composure. Plus a shocking safari incident.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Tragic Tsunami, Plummeting Plane, Canadian Catastrophe
programme.desc: Footage of near disasters, featuring a train hauling toxic materials crashing into a trapped truck and a plane suffering engine failure while in flight.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini purchases a 1941 Ford Woody, with only 15,000 miles on the clock.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer is on the lookout for a two-seat roadster with attitude in the form of an original BMW Z1, which could make a tidy profit after Edd China works his magic.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle join an architectural salvage crew on a special mission, while Robbie and Frank hunt for treasure in an old theatre-turned-prop warehouse.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard meets his match in north Wales during a negotiation, finds forgotten treasures on a Warwick estate, and haggles with a hoarder from Wiltshire.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The gang hits the UK's biggest car show in Birmingham to showcase six of their favourite builds to the public. Plus, a review of the past year at the Garage.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. The duo head to Staffordshire on the trail of a Ford Capri. They find a beauty, but it's got tatty bodywork and needs a new interior.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How the world's sharpest photos are taken. Plus, the stitching of an airbag capable of catching a falling car, and the manufacture of billions of perfectly-formed jelly beans.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How a caravan tougher than an SUV can be built. Plus, forging tuning forks with perfect pitch, resurfacing an ice rink in minutes, and staging on the world's biggest light festival.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: A student is found dead in a university and a suspect is quickly arrested. However, it is a race against time when another killing suggests the police have held the wrong person.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A comparison between the work of crime writers and real-life accounts from homicide investigators, proving reality can be stranger than fiction.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: After watching the cult classic, a couple were inspired to mimic the actions in their fight for love. What made these killers commit such an atrocious crime? S3/20/20

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The 2011 murder of Melissa White, whose body was found in her backyard. When investigators took a closer look at the neighbours, they unearthed a secret and had to work out whether it could be connected with the killing.

programme.title: Jodi Arias: An American Murder Mystery
programme.desc: Jodi Arias became a media sensation as soon as her trial for murder began. As the proceedings unfolded, her story changed dramatically, and nothing was as it once seemed.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator Racelle Carlson faces the challenge of checking on a house full of dogs. Two brothers live there, but at first they won't let anyone inside the property.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Harriet the Bearded Dragon has a worrying lump on the side of her leg that requires an urgent operation, and a sick 10-week-old puppy is put in danger by her protective owner.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The brutally honest assessment of her twin sister leaves future bride Vicky struggling to pick a gown, while a mother and daughter come in for a double fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Caitie and her wedding planner father clash over a gown, while Danielle lost her mother to cancer, so her dad steps in to help her make the big decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: David and Danielle assist fussy bride Katie, who has fruitlessly tried on countless dresses, and Antonia who has a long list of what she doesn't want on a wedding dress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown heads to Abu Dhabi after a special invitation to visit an extraordinary veterinary hospital, where sick and injured falcons are treated like royalty.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The rescue team saves a dog trapped underneath a house, the SPCA investigates the death of a horse and Maverick seeks justice for the death of two huskies.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The SPCA responds to news of an illegal cockfighting contest taking place, and surround the organisers in a nearby wood. Meanwhile two sick horses worry the team.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore rescues an old chimney pot, a wooden chest and a discarded bed, items that she and two other recycling experts restore before she tries to sell them for a profit.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into the work of toxicologists, who use blood and tissue samples to solve gruesome murder cases.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of John Glasgow, an Arkansas chief financial officer whose car was found abandoned in a state park a day after he left his Little Rock home for work in 2008. It was later claimed he had been killed by disreputable creditors, but this has never been proved.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 30-year-old teacher and former beauty queen Tara Grinstead, who vanished from her Georgia home on October 24, 2005. An abandoned latex glove was found in her backyard and police learned she had enjoyed a complex series of relationships with men.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride wants a colourful gown to go with her theme for the big day, but her mother has other ideas. A customer looks for a dress that will make a dramatic impression.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: High School Musical star Corbin Bleu helps his fiancee choose a dress, while a bride disagrees with her fiance over the style of gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I'm Not the Size of a Hanger!
programme.desc: A bride prepares for a beer-themed wedding, while a customer seeks the help of her friends in choosing a dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The wedding guru herself, Martha Stewart, visits Kleinfeld, hoping to help bride Bailey choose her perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Randy has a surprise in store for a military veteran planning her wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Joelle tries on her mother's dress from the 1980s, and another customer declares herself the anti-bride.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Paralympic athlete Amy Purdy isn't afraid to take risks, such as waiting to find her dress just three weeks before the big day. Plus, Lori's wedding is just nine days ahead.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Not Afraid to Try New Things
programme.desc: Excited wedding planner Rachel tries on some 'edgy' dresses. Natalie wants a unique gown, but knows her traditionally minded mother may not approve. Kleinfeld employee Subrina hopes her customised dress will match her vision.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: When architectural salvage hunter Drew Pritchard and his sidekick Tee gain access to a recently closed department store, they face a potentially almighty shopping spree.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore rescues an old chimney pot, a wooden chest and a discarded bed, items that she and two other recycling experts restore before she tries to sell them for a profit.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Having spent the last two years in his bed due to his weight, Cillas' food addiction has hampered his relationship with his fiance and her three daughters.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Phillip Fraser's daughter talks about the murderer, who killed his ex-wife in 1997, before stabbing another former partner to death while out on licence.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The murder of John Proctor, by his neice Susan Warne. When the seemingly healthy 80-year-old was found dead at home, police were stumped. But, Warne was hiding a dark secret that lead to his death.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Peter Tobin: Manhunt for a Serial Killer
programme.desc: DS David Swindle and forensic scientist Carol Rogers recount how the murder of Angelika Kluk in 2006 was linked to a serial killer.
